meanings.definition: Feigners: those who pretend or deceive
meanings.sent1: The group of feigners acted like they were injured to get sympathy.
meanings.sent2: The feigners at the party pretended to be interested in the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The feigners in the play exaggerated their emotions for comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: The feigners in the courtroom were skilled at manipulating the truth.
meanings.sent5: The feigners in the movie made the audience question what was real.

meanings.definition: Feigners: to pretend or fake something
meanings.sent1: She would often feign illness to avoid going to school.
meanings.sent2: He tried to feign surprise when he saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent3: The cat would feign interest in the toy mouse before pouncing on it.
meanings.sent4: The politician would feign concern for the environment during speeches.
meanings.sent5: The actor had to feign happiness even though he was feeling sad.
